Title: XAI for Predictive Maintenance
Authors: João Gama, Sławomir Nowaczyk, Sepideh Pashami, Rita P. Ribeiro, Grzegorz J. Nalepa, Bruno Veloso
Abstract summary: The paper discusses open challenges in integrating AI-based predictive maintenance with human expertise and decision-making processes.

Title: Hybrid-augmented intelligence in predictive maintenance with digital intelligent assistants
Authors: S. Wellsandt, Konstantin Klein, K. Hribernik, M. Lewandowski, Alexandros Bousdekis, G. Mentzas, K. Thoben
Abstract summary: Hybrid-augmented intelligence using digital intelligent assistants can enhance predictive maintenance systems, but faces technical, social, and other challenges.

Title: Artificial Intelligence for Predictive Maintenance Applications: Key Components, Trustworthiness, and Future Trends
Authors: Aysegul Ucar, Mehmet Karakose, Necim Kırımça
Abstract summary: The paper discusses key components, trustworthiness, and future trends of using AI for predictive maintenance, but does not mention open questions in human expertise modeling.

Title: Predictive maintenance enabled by machine learning: Use cases and challenges in the automotive industry
Authors: Andreas Theissler, Judith Pérez-Velázquez, M. Kettelgerdes, G. Elger
Abstract summary: The paper discusses the use of machine learning for predictive maintenance in the automotive industry, identifying open challenges such as the need for publicly available data and efficient, interpretable deep learning methods.

Title: Predictive maintenance for industry 5.0: behavioural inquiries from a work system perspective
Authors: Bas van Oudenhoven, P. V. D. Calseyde, R. Basten, E. Demerouti
Abstract summary: The paper identifies four factors that facilitate adoption of predictive maintenance systems: trust, control, cognitive resources, and organizational decision-making.

Title: Human-in-the-Loop Large-Scale Predictive Maintenance of Workstations
Abstract summary: This paper proposes a human-in-the-loop approach to predictive maintenance of workstations using machine learning and expert feedback.

Title: Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI) Approaches in Predictive Maintenance: A Review
Authors: Jeetesh Sharma, Murari Lal Mittal, G. Soni, A. Keprate
Abstract summary: The paper reviews the use of explainable AI (XAI) techniques in predictive maintenance to address the black-box nature of many machine learning models.

Title: Explainable Predictive Maintenance of Rotating Machines Using LIME, SHAP, PDP, ICE
Authors: S. Gawde, S. Patil, Satish Kumar, P. Kamat, K. Kotecha, Sultan Alfarhood
Abstract summary: The paper presents an explainable AI-based approach for predictive maintenance of industrial rotating machines using LIME, SHAP, PDP, and ICE.
